event: Here is the table of events and timestamps:
pocket infection of his cardiac resynchronization therapy defibrillator
erythema and discomfort around his left upper chest implant site
echocardiography severely reduced left ventricular systolic function
global hypokinesis of the left ventricle
preoperative computed tomography leads scarred to the lateral wall of the superior vena cava
coronary sinus and right atrial leads extracted
5-mm tear in the superior cavoatrial junction
oozing hematoma at the level of the innominate vein
right ventricular lead capped and abandoned
26 units of blood products given intraoperatively
10 units of packed red blood cells given intraoperatively
postoperative transfer to the intensive care unit
bilateral, symmetrical cyanotic changes to all 5 digits of his upper and lower extremities
upper- and lower-digit ischemia progressed to dry gangrene
inability to move fingers and toes
Doppler study flat waveforms on all digits and toes bilaterally
liver enzymes returned to normal limits
purulent, foul-smelling material from his left infraclavicular operative site
stabilized and transferred to our facility
laser extraction of his retained lead
pus drained from the subfascial area
evaluation of his hands and feet
no signs of local infection or wet gangrene
black skin changes and demarcation lines
frank mummification of his digits and toes
amputation and debridement of his necrotic feet
